section.name: Ant Tasks
section.p: To use the Ant tasks, copy commons-jar.jar and its dependencies into the $ANT_HOME/lib directory, and use the following in your Ant scipt to define the tasks:
Alternatively, you can provide an explicit classpath when you define the tasks:

section.name: Copy
section.p: Copies a set of files to a destination folder. Does not copy source files where the destination file exists and is newer than the source file. The copy task takes the following attributes:

tr.td: The destination folder. This folder is created if it does not exist.
The destination file. Can only be used if there is a single source file.
Always copy files, ignoring the last-modified time of the destination file.
Set the last-modified time of destination files to the same value as the source files. May not be supported by the destination file system.
A source file or folder to copy. Copies all descendents of a folder.

section.name: Move
section.p: Moves a set of files to a destination folder. Has the same attributes and elements as the copy task.

section.name: Sync
section.p: Synchronises a destination folder with a set of source files. Has the same attributes and elements as the copy task.

section.name: Delete
section.p: Deletes a file or folder. It takes the following attributes:

tr.td: The file or folder to delete. All descendents of the folder are deleted.
